poem:
Title: "The Pawns of Power"

PwC, in the corporate halls,
Suspend judgment, where money falls.
An advise whispered, a caution mute,
In the dance of foreign loot.

Greens standing, as Pocock warns,
Against subtle deceit in words adorned.
Taxmen question, their doubts unfurl,
Around the axis, the truth twirls.

In this game of power and light,
Who deigns to subvert, under the cover of night?
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "PwC to face scrutiny over advice to clients that might allegedly ‘mislead or subvert’ foreign investment review board The Greens senator Barbara Pocock has warned consultancy PwC Australia faces fresh scrutiny after the Australian Taxation Office revealed it had queried advice given to clients that might “mislead or subvert” foreign investment review board processes. The details were revealed in answers to questions Pocock put to the ATO about a meeting between the office commissioner Jeremy". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
